creditline: Gift of Elizabeth, Julie, and Catherine Andrus in memory of John and Marion Andrus
description: large stone building with small windows on a cliff at L; sailboat in loch near cliff; high, rugged hills behind low plains at R
inscription:
-- in graphite on recto: Lochend J Clerk / Printed by Lumsden. 1920. &Arthurs Seat. Eldin
-- in graphite on verso: L.49 | Arthurs Seat, from Lochend / (First plate)
provenance: John E. Andrus III, Wayzata, Minn.; by descent to his daughters, Elizabeth, Katie, and Julie; gave to MIA, 2015. Earlier provenances have been gathered, but further research will increase our knowledge of their histories.
title: Arthur's Seat from Lochend
